#Text=New denunciations of Brazilian deputy and evidence make things difficult for Lula
#Text=Sunday , July 3 , 2005
#Text=São Paulo , Brazil
#Text=— On June 30 , in Brazil , deputy Roberto Jefferson testified to deputies and senators of a Commission that is investigating the alleged Post Office Service scandal .
#Text=Jefferson 's testimony along with new evidence supporting his testimony are putting the government of President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva in a difficult situation .
#Text=Roberto Jefferson 's testimony ran from 4 p.m. to close to 2 a.m. ( local time ) .
#Text=The deputy further explained the alleged corruption scheme involving the Brazilian Workers ' Party ( PT ) .
#Text=The testimony of Jefferson was at times very tense , and sometimes discussions between Jefferson and deputies of the Workers Party become heated .

#Text=In one instance , a Workers ' Party deputy attacked Jefferson 's credibility , calling him a liar on the basis that he supported the former Brazilian President Fernando Collor de Mello , who suffered impeachment for corruption related to Treasurer Paulo Cesar Farias , who worked on Collor 's campaign .

#Text=Jefferson answered : " PC Farias is a chick when you see the corruption in PT " , and accused the former governor of Rio Grande do Sul Olivio Dutra ( Olivio Dutra is the minister of Lula at the present time ) of involvement with the " Jogo do Bicho " ( illegal gambling ) .

column1: #Text=According to Jefferson , the President of the Worker 's Party José Genuino , former Minister José Dirceu , Secretary-General Sílvio Pereira , and Treasurer Delúbio Soares , head a widespread national corruption scheme which involves the Workers Party , members of the Government , the Brazilian Agency of Intelligence , and both government and private enterprises .
#Text=Jefferson said the President was unaware of this scheme .
#Text=Some members of parliament from the opposition see this claim as strange .
#Text=During his last testimony , Jefferson said that entrepreneur Marcos Valério was responsible for finacing the payment of deputies of the alleged Votes-for-cash scandal .
#Text=This week , investigations by the police showed that Marcos Valério withdrew , in cash , large sums of money from Rural Bank .
#Text=According to Jefferson , this money was used to pay deputies .
#Text=Valério said that he used the money to buy cattle and that farmers do n't like to receive cheques , just " real money " .
#Text=His explanation was considered suspect and his former secretary said she does not know of any farms owned by Valerio .
#Text=Marcos Valério is part-owner of SMPB and DNA .
#Text=Documents from the Agrarian Reform Institute ( INCRA ) showed that Valério 's enterprises owned 10 big farms .
#Text=According to an article published by the newspaper O Estado de São Paulo on July 1 , at least two of these farms do not exist .
#Text=The Brazilian Federal Police said that there is evidence sufficient to indict Valério .
#Text=The accusations against Valério are tax evasion and money laundering .

#Text=According to Internal Revenue Service , Marcos Valério 's fortune was R$ 230,000 ( 97,676.27 USD - Live mid-market rates as of July 3 , 2005 , 12:47:43 UTC . ) in 1997 and R$ 14,000,000 ( 5,945,511.97 USD ) in 2004 , a growth of 6086 % .
#Text=The enterprises of Valério , SMPB and DNA , have contracts with five Ministeries and eight big public enterprises , including the Post Office Service .
#Text=Before his testimony to the Commission , Jefferson said that Furnas , an energy company in Brazil , was involved in a corruption scheme .
#Text=According to Jefferson , money from the enterprise was moved to the Workers ' Party of Minas Gerais , to the treasurer Delúbio Soares , to be used to buy deputies .
#Text=Furnas denied this .
#Text=Presidente Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva said that the allegations should be investigated .
#Text=Under pressure the Furnas ' directors resigned .

#Text=On July 2 , newspapers reported that according to Brazilian Central Bank 's documents , in February 17 , 2004 , the Workers ' Party borrowed R$ 2.4 millions ( 1,019,230.62 USD ) from Marcos Valério .
#Text=In addition , the documents named José Genoíno ( the President of the Workers ' Party ) and Delúbio Soares ( the treasurer ) .
#Text=After initially denying that the magazine had taken out this loan , the President of the Workers ' Party acknowledged it to journalists on Saturday , July 2 .
#Text=Delúbio Soares cried during his speech last week and said that the accusations are not true and that the " right " is trying to impeach President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva on false charges .
#Text=The testimony of Jefferson is at the center of discussions in Brazil .
#Text=According to the PMDB leader , Senator Ney Suassuna , the denunciations are " nitroglycerine which are thrown into the arteries of the Republic every minute " .
#Text=Leader of the PSDB , Arthur Virgílio Neto , said that the government lives in darkness .
#Text=Senator Peter Simon ( PMDB-RS ) appealed to President Lula to do an ethical turn-around , and respect the imperatives of morality and seriousness in government .
#Text=According to Simon : " Today society is still saying that president Lula is a man of good .
